intro: Scurrula canescens, commonly known as the silver scurrula, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its silver-gray, hairy leaves and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported anti-inflammatory properties. Scurrula canescens is also valued as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and resilience.
